2025-03.daily_overview: On her Saturday off, Yu Xiaowen spent time alone reflecting and planning. She took the opportunity to evaluate the effectiveness of her new routine and the Pomodoro Technique from the previous week, while also relaxing through music and reading. However, she felt slightly fatigued in the evening due to an unexpected online meeting.

events.name: Habitual Review and Adjustment
events.description: In the morning, Yu Xiaowen sat at her desk at home, took out this week's schedule book, and carefully reviewed her experiences of implementing early morning runs and the Pomodoro Technique for evening study over the past week. She noted several significant improvements, such as feeling more energetic after morning runs, but also discovered difficulties in executing the routine the morning after night shifts. As a result, she adjusted her plan for the following week to [replace morning runs with home stretching exercises on the day after night shifts], aiming to solidify her new habits in a more humanized way.

events.name: Immersive Classical Music Appreciation
events.description: In the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen nestled on the sofa, playing Schubert's vocal cycle "Winterreise" through high-quality headphones. The early spring afternoon sunlight streamed into the living room, and the profound emotions and serene atmosphere in the music allowed her to completely detach from a week of intense work, providing deep spiritual comfort.

events.name: Temporary Online Medical Meeting
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen received a notification from the hospital and attended an emergency online meeting about the prevention and treatment of spring influenza, which lasted about 40 minutes. This disrupted her original reading plan and left her feeling slightly fatigued.

结束状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.

2025-03.daily_overview: On a tranquil Sunday, Yu Xiaowen primarily focused on self-care and emotional connection with her family. She maintained a sense of order in her life through regular exercise, tending to her green plants, and video calls with her parents, but she stayed up slightly late at night due to excessive reading.

events.name: Morning jogging and body stretching.
events.description: According to the adjusted plan, Yu Xiaowen completed a 5-kilometer morning run in the community park. The early spring morning air was slightly cool, and while running, she focused on her breathing and pace, feeling fully awakened. After returning home, she performed 15 minutes of stretching to relieve muscle tension.

events.name: Caring for Indoor Green Plants
events.description: In the morning, Yu Xiaowen watered and wiped the leaves of her potted green plants, and checked on the growth of her fiddle-leaf fig. Seeing them so vibrant, she felt a simple sense of satisfaction and a connection with nature.

events.name: Routine video call with parents.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen took the initiative to make a video call to her parents in Luoyang. She shared a small achievement from her work this week—successfully admitting a patient—and listened to her parents talk about the little things in their lives and the new changes in their garden. The conversation was light and pleasant, with her parents reminding her to take care of her health, while she advised them to adjust their clothing according to the fluctuating spring temperatures.

events.name: Deeply reading a medical novel.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen was captivated by a medical novel about the life of a doctor, reading late into the night, which caused her bedtime to be delayed.

2025-03.daily_overview: On the first workday of the week, Yu Xiaowen faced a significant test of her professional competence—independently admitting a newly admitted patient with heart failure in the cardiology department for the first time. From receiving the information during the morning meeting to completing the medical record late at night, she took full charge throughout the process, significantly boosting her professional confidence, though she felt a bit tired from working overtime.

events.name: Morning Meeting Reception and Information Reception
events.description: After the morning shift handover meeting in the department, the night shift colleague provided Yu Xiaowen with a detailed handover regarding a newly admitted elderly male patient with heart failure. This included the preliminary diagnosis from the emergency department at night [acute left heart failure], vital signs after emergency medication treatment, and the pending tests that need to be completed.

events.name: Complete the admission assessment independently.
events.description: Yu Xiaowen arrived at the ward and conducted a systematic and patient inquiry into the medical history, along with a comprehensive physical examination of the somewhat anxious patient. She paid particular attention to signs of heart failure, such as the patient's degree of breathing difficulty, lung crackles, jugular vein distension, and lower limb edema, while using a gentle tone to soothe the patient's nervousness.

events.name: Draft a preliminary diagnosis and treatment plan
events.description: Returning to the doctor's workstation, Yu Xiaowen integrated the patient's newly available blood test results (showing a significant increase in BNP) and chest X-ray findings (indicating pulmonary congestion). She quickly reviewed the latest version of the heart failure diagnosis and treatment guidelines and drafted a preliminary plan. This plan included the use of diuretics to reduce cardiac load, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors to improve prognosis, and arrangements for further examinations such as cardiac ultrasound.

events.name: Report to the supervising teacher and receive guidance.
events.description: Yu Xiaowen presented the medical records and preliminary plan to her supervising teacher, Li Wei, giving a clear report. Teacher Li acknowledged her quick grasp of the patient's condition and diagnostic direction, while also providing crucial guidance on the specific dosage of diuretics, the timing of administration, and the importance of monitoring electrolyte levels. He reminded her to pay attention to the patient's baseline renal function.

events.name: Issue medical orders and communicate with the nursing team.
events.description: Based on the discussion with Teacher Li, Yu Xiaowen refined and formally issued both long-term and temporary medical orders. She specifically went to the nursing station to communicate face-to-face with Head Nurse Wu Min about the key points of the patient's care, such as accurately recording intake and output and monitoring blood pressure changes, to ensure the smooth implementation of the treatment plan.

events.name: Conduct informed consent notification to the patient's family members.
events.description: In the afternoon, the patient's son arrived at the hospital. In the doctor-patient communication room, Yu Xiaowen explained the father's condition, treatment principles, expected outcomes, and potential risks in simple and understandable language. She patiently addressed multiple questions from the family regarding medication and prognosis, and assisted in signing the necessary informed consent forms.

events.name: Standardize the writing of the initial course record.
events.description: Before leaving work, Yu Xiaowen concentrated on writing the patient's first course record at her computer. She strived to ensure the content was standardized and complete, clearly presenting the case characteristics, diagnostic basis, differential diagnosis, and treatment plan, and submitted it in the hospital's electronic medical record system.

events.name: Personal Clinical Review and Summary
events.description: After returning home in the evening, Yu Xiaowen ate a simple meal while mentally reviewing the entire process of independently treating patients that day. She recorded several areas for improvement pointed out by Teacher Li (such as systematically ruling out other causes during consultations) in the [Experience and Reflection] section of her personal study notes, feeling a great sense of fulfillment.

起始状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
起始状态.心情: Slightly nervous but full of anticipation

结束状态.所处地点: Home Study Room, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Tired but filled with a sense of accomplishment and confidence.

2025-03.daily_overview: On an ordinary workday, Yu Xiaowen, after the excitement of independently handling consultations yesterday, returned to her routine tasks of ward management, following up on medical orders, and communicating with patients. The spring rain made commuting slightly inconvenient, but she managed to unwind with an evening run, though she felt a bit stressed due to unexpected overtime work.

events.name: Follow up on the condition of the newly admitted patient from yesterday.
events.description: During the morning ward round, Yu Xiaowen focused on observing the heart failure patient admitted the previous day. She was pleased to see that the patient's breathing difficulties had significantly improved after diuretic treatment, and urine output had increased. Based on the rechecked electrolyte results, she made slight adjustments to the potassium supplementation plan and explained the signs of improvement in the patient's condition.

events.name: Handling routine affairs in the ward
events.description: Today, the patients under Yu Xiaowen's care are in relatively stable condition. She took the time to respond in detail to several medication consultation calls from discharged patients, prescribed discharge medications and rehabilitation guidance for two patients about to be discharged, and supplemented several progress notes.

events.name: A brief lunchtime exchange with colleagues.
events.description: During the lunch break, Yu Xiaowen and her colleague Wang Fang had a meal together in the hospital cafeteria. Wang Fang curiously asked about her experience of independently treating patients the day before. Yu Xiaowen shared some details, while Wang Fang recounted an interesting case she had encountered in the pediatrics department. Their light-hearted conversation helped alleviate the stress of work.

events.name: Learn a new technique for interpreting electrocardiograms.
events.description: During a work break in the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen watched a short video course on [How to Quickly Identify High-Risk ECG] on a medical learning app on her phone. As she watched, she sketched several key waveforms in her notebook, feeling that it would be very helpful for screening emergencies during night shifts.

events.name: Evening jog for relaxation.
events.description: After work, Yu Xiaowen went for a 30-minute jog at a moderate pace in a park near her home to help relieve the stress of the day, but she got slightly distracted by thinking about work issues while running.

起始状态.心情: Smooth

结束状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
结束状态.心情: Calm, slightly rewarding but mildly fatigued.

state.今日运动: Run for 30 minutes in the evening.

2025-03.daily_overview: This day was filled with challenges and changes. During the day, Yu Xiaowen efficiently completed her clinical work and research tasks. However, at night, she received news that her landlord was planning to sell the property. The stable living environment she had relied on suddenly faced a crisis, causing her emotions to shift from the professional focus of the day to anxiety and disappointment late at night, ultimately leading to staying up late.

events.name: Handling emergency night shifts independently for the first time.
events.description: Yu Xiaowen was on her first independent night shift in the cardiology department. In the early hours of the morning, a hospitalized patient with coronary heart disease suddenly developed rapid atrial fibrillation, accompanied by palpitations and shortness of breath. Yu Xiaowen quickly rushed to the bedside, assessed the situation, and administered an intravenous injection of amiodarone according to the guidelines. She stayed by the patient's side, closely monitoring the heart rate and blood pressure. After about half an hour, the patient successfully converted to sinus rhythm, and the symptoms were relieved. Only then did she breathe a sigh of relief.

events.name: Attend the kick-off meeting for the department's research project.
events.description: In the afternoon, department director Zhang Lei presided over the project kick-off meeting for the [Retrospective Study on Long-term Management Effectiveness of Hypertensive Patients]. Yu Xiaowen clarified that her task was to retrospectively collect and organize the medical records of 200 hypertensive inpatients within a specified period, and she diligently recorded the standardized requirements for data extraction.

events.name: Received a notice from the landlord about selling the property, triggering a housing crisis.
events.description: Shortly after returning home from work in the evening, Yu Xiaowen received a long WeChat voice message from her landlord, Aunt Song. In an apologetic tone, Aunt Song explained that due to her son’s upcoming wedding in the second half of the year and the urgent need for a marital home, she had decided to sell the apartment Xiaowen was currently renting. The lease would not be renewed upon its expiration (around summer), and she hoped Xiaowen could understand and cooperate with potential viewings. This news felt like a heavy stone thrown into a calm lake. As Xiaowen looked at the small home she had carefully arranged and lived in for nearly three years, she was instantly overwhelmed by a strong sense of loss, unease, and anxiety about the uncertain future, making it difficult for her to fall asleep.

起始状态.所处地点: Home bedroom at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
起始状态.心情: Slightly fatigued from the night shift but mentally focused.

结束状态.所处地点: In the living room of the home at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
结束状态.心情: Shock, anxiety, loss, and difficulty falling asleep.

2025-03.daily_overview: The shadow of the housing crisis loomed over the entire day. During work breaks, Yu Xiaowen still found her mind wandering to the issue of housing. She confided in her close friend for emotional support and was also invited by colleagues to explore new ways to relieve stress. She began to face the problem rationally, but at night, anxiety led to poor sleep.

events.name: Confide in close friend Zhang Jing to seek support.
events.description: During the morning break, Yu Xiaowen, feeling restless, confided in her close friend Zhang Jing via WeChat voice message about the news that her landlord was planning to sell the house. Zhang Jing immediately expressed her concern and support upon hearing this. Over the phone, the two began to discuss potential future options, such as renting a two-bedroom apartment together in another district of Zhengzhou or each finding a small place to live alone. They weighed the pros and cons and considered their budgets.

events.name: Discussing New Stress-Relief Experiences with Colleagues – Live-Ammunition Shooting
events.description: During the lunch break, my colleague Wang Fang excitedly shared her experience of live-fire shooting from last week, describing the sense of release when pulling the trigger and strongly recommending that Yu Xiaowen give it a try. Yu Xiaowen was intrigued but also concerned about safety. The two of them used their phones to search for several licensed shooting ranges in Zhengzhou, checking their qualifications, prices, and reservation requirements.

events.name: Proactively contact the landlord to confirm the arrangements.
events.description: To take the initiative, Yu Xiaowen called her landlord, Aunt Song, after work. She inquired in detail about the approximate timeline for the house sale, the specific date of the lease expiration (end of July), and the possible frequency of house viewings. Aunt Song assured her that she would try to schedule viewings in a concentrated manner to minimize disruption and once again expressed her apologies.

events.name: Preliminary Calculation of Future Rental Costs
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen sat at her desk, opened a rental app and a calculator. Considering the current rental market situation in Zhengzhou (monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in Jinshui District is approximately 2,500–3,000 yuan), she roughly calculated the potential costs of moving: a two-month deposit plus one month’s rent (about 7,500 yuan), an agency fee (equivalent to one month’s rent), and moving expenses (around 500 yuan). This made her realize she needed to prepare a substantial amount of [emergency funds] in advance, which intensified her anxiety.

起始状态.所处地点: No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province, China, in the bedroom of the home.
起始状态.心情: Lack of sleep, heavy heart.

结束状态.所处地点: Home Study Room, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Anxious but beginning to shift toward rational planning and contemplation, tossing and turning at night.

date_attribute.weather: Cloudy, with light rain in the evening.

2025-03.daily_overview: On Friday, Yu Xiaowen continued to multitask in addressing the housing crisis. She had an honest conversation with her parents, gaining emotional support from afar; she confirmed a weekend gathering with her close friend to discuss co-living arrangements in depth; and she began browsing rental information at a practical level, gradually transforming anxiety into concrete action steps. However, she stayed up late due to overthinking.

events.name: Video call parents to inform them of the change.
events.description: That evening, Yu Xiaowen took the initiative to video call her parents in Luoyang. Unlike her usual habit of only sharing good news, she honestly told them about the landlord’s decision to sell the house and her need to move. Her mother, Li Xiuying, immediately showed concern, asking if she needed financial support or if she wanted to come back to Luoyang for a while. Her father, Yu Jianguo, was more rational, advising her to focus on stabilizing her job while actively searching for a new place in Zhengzhou. He also offered to help inquire about housing options through acquaintances. Their care made her feel she wasn’t facing this alone.

events.name: Confirming weekend dinner plans with best friend Zhang Jing.
events.description: Yu Xiaowen contacted Zhang Jing via WeChat, and they decided to meet on Saturday evening for a detailed discussion. They chose a well-reviewed newly opened Henan cuisine restaurant, and Yu Xiaowen reserved a table in advance through an app, looking forward to a face-to-face conversation that would allow them to thoroughly explore the possibility of sharing an apartment.

events.name: Initial Browsing of Rental Market Information
events.description: Before going to bed, Yu Xiaowen opened the rental app again. This time, she had a clearer goal in mind: a residential complex within a 30-minute commute to the hospital, with a budget under 3,000 yuan, and a high safety rating. She filtered listings in the Jinshui District and Zhongyuan District (where the hospital is located), saved a few one-bedroom apartments and shared two-bedroom rooms that looked promising, and gained a more intuitive understanding of the market situation. However, she browsed until late into the night.

起始状态.所处地点: In the bedroom of the home at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
起始状态.心情: There is still pressure, but now there is more comfort from family.

结束状态.所处地点: Home bedroom at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Having something to rely on, the direction of action gradually becomes clear, but thoughts are chaotic before sleep.

date_attribute.weather: Clear and sunny, with a gentle, warm spring breeze.

2025-03.daily_overview: A Saturday filled with activities. In the morning, Yu Xiaowen studied financial management knowledge to cope with financial changes; in the afternoon, she experienced the highly impactful live-fire shooting with her colleagues, effectively releasing stress; after returning home in the evening, she immediately put the financial management concepts she learned into practice by setting up a [Rental Emergency Fund], transforming her sense of crisis into concrete financial defensive actions, but she stayed up late due to excitement.

events.name: Learn online financial management courses
events.description: In the morning, Yu Xiaowen attended the third online course recommended by financial advisor Wang Mingyuan, with the theme of [Asset Allocation and Life Cycle Theory]. The lecturer explained in detail the Standard & Poor's Family Asset Quadrant Chart and how to allocate assets based on age and risk tolerance. Reflecting on her upcoming significant expenses and conservative preferences, Yu Xiaowen took careful notes and contemplated how to adjust her existing fund investments.

events.name: Experience live-fire shooting to release stress.
events.description: In the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen and Wang Fang went together to a formal shooting range in the suburbs. After undergoing strict safety training, she put on protective goggles and earmuffs and, under the guidance of an instructor, experienced shooting with both a pistol and a rifle. The powerful recoil and loud noise the moment she pulled the trigger made her heart race, but the sense of achievement from hitting the target afterward brought a strong feeling of release. She and Wang Fang showed each other their target sheets, excitedly sharing their experiences.

events.name: Establish a [Rental Emergency Fund] account
events.description: After returning home in the evening, once the excitement from shooting had subsided, the reality of living pressures resurfaced. She immediately took action, opened her mobile banking app, and created a new sub-account under her financial management account, naming it [Rental Emergency Fund]. She transferred a total of 5,000 yuan as the initial capital, which included part of her idle funds for the month and the budget originally allocated for entertainment expenses.

events.name: Develop a fund fixed deposit plan.
events.description: To ensure she saves enough money before the lease expires (assuming by the end of July), Yu Xiaowen set up an automatic transfer of 2,000 yuan from her salary card into the [Rental Emergency Fund] account on the 10th of each month (after payday). She checked the account balance and the automatic deduction settings, feeling a sense of control from [preparing for a rainy day] that slightly offset her earlier sense of helplessness, though she ended up dealing with financial matters until late.

起始状态.心情: Relaxing on the weekend, with a hint of study pressure.

结束状态.所处地点: Home study at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
结束状态.心情: After experiencing excitement and release, it ultimately returns to a pragmatic calmness, yet with a slight excitement.

date_attribute.weather: Cloudy, turning sunny in the afternoon.

2025-03.daily_overview: On Sunday, Yu Xiaowen's main plan was to have dinner with her close friend Zhang Jing to discuss the possibility of sharing an apartment. This conversation shifted their focus from idealistic visions to practical considerations. During the meal, she ate a bit more than usual, resulting in a slight weight gain. However, she stayed up late at night due to overthinking.

events.name: Dinner gathering with my best friend Zhang Jing
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen and Zhang Jing met at that Henan cuisine restaurant. With delicious food before them, the two chatted casually about their recent work situations. Yu Xiaowen detailed the ins and outs of her landlord selling the apartment and the financial pressure she had calculated, formally proposing the idea of sharing the rent. Zhang Jing expressed great understanding and support, willing to explore this option together.

events.name: In-depth Exploration of the Pros and Cons and Needs of Co-renting
events.description: At the dining table, their conversation gradually deepened. They discussed practical issues such as the ideal area for co-renting (preferably midway between their workplaces), the maximum rental budget, habits regarding the use of shared spaces, and the division of cleaning responsibilities. Yu Xiaowen realized that, as a doctor who works night shifts and has an irregular schedule, her lifestyle might conflict with that of Zhang Jing, a teacher with a regular nine-to-five routine—a challenge she hadn’t considered in detail before.

events.name: Agreement to jointly view properties in the future.
events.description: Despite being aware of potential difficulties, both of them held expectations for maintaining their friendship and saving on expenses. They agreed that in the coming weeks, each would first browse listings on the app and share suitable options in WeChat. They also tentatively planned to view one or two apartments together the following weekend if both were available.

events.name: Sort out a personal checklist for house hunting.
events.description: When she got home in the evening, Yu Xiaowen took out her notebook and compiled a clearer list of requirements for finding an apartment: 1. Commute to the hospital ≤ 30 minutes (by subway or car); 2. A safe community with standardized property management; 3. Monthly rent (including property fees) not exceeding 3,000 yuan; 4. If sharing an apartment, she hopes to have a private bathroom; 5. Good lighting, with enough space for her desk and potted plants. This list made her feel that her goals were clearer, but she pondered it until late into the night.

起始状态.所处地点: Home bedroom at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
起始状态.心情: Looking forward to meeting friends, with a slight tension of discussing serious matters.

结束状态.所处地点: Home living room at No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
结束状态.心情: After the conversation, my thoughts grew more numerous. There was a sense of reassurance in finding an ally, but also a new awareness of the complexities of cohabitation, leaving me feeling slightly weary.

2025-03.daily_overview: A new week begins, and Yu Xiaowen strives to bring her life back on track. Work remains her anchor, and her active participation in case discussions earns her recognition. Meanwhile, she actively regulates her fluctuating emotions caused by housing issues through her favorite methods—music and planning a concert. She also discovers the hidden impact of stress on her evening running data.

events.name: Participate in difficult case discussion meetings
events.description: The department organized a challenging case discussion on complex arrhythmias (polymorphic ventricular tachycardia). Yu Xiaowen reviewed relevant guidelines and literature in advance. During the meeting, she not only attentively listened to the analysis from the department head and senior doctors but also shared her insights on the relationship between correcting the patient's electrolyte imbalance and arrhythmia, earning a nod of approval from her mentor, Li Wei.

events.name: Using Music to Alleviate the Fatigue of Night Shifts
events.description: After waking up from a daytime nap following a night shift, Yu Xiaowen still felt exhausted. In a chat group with her close friends, she shared a serene aria excerpt from Bach's "Goldberg Variations" and wrote, [Listening to this after every night shift helps my heartbeat and thoughts gradually settle down]. Several friends responded, expressing similar feelings or offering comfort.

events.name: Book tickets for a classical music concert
events.description: To give her recent anxiety-filled life something to [look forward to] and an emotional outlet, Yu Xiaowen browsed the Zhengzhou Grand Theater's official account during a work break and discovered that a symphony concert featuring works by Dvořák and Brahms was scheduled to perform soon. Without much hesitation, she selected a good seat online and paid for the ticket, looking forward to comforting herself with a live music feast.

events.name: Observing the New Shoots of Green Plants to Gain Small Joys
events.description: While watering the plants in the morning, she was pleasantly surprised to find a tender green sprout emerging from the top of her fiddle-leaf fig, looking especially vibrant under the sunlight. She took a photo with her phone and was instantly touched by this small display of life’s vitality, which brightened her mood considerably.

events.name: Evening running data anomaly
events.description: After work, Yu Xiaowen went for a 30-minute jog, but her fitness app showed that her average pace had slowed by about 20 seconds per kilometer compared to last month, and her resting heart rate had increased. She realized the impact of stress on her body.

起始状态.心情: After adjusting over the weekend, my mindset has become relatively stable.

结束状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
结束状态.心情: Daytime work yields results, evening brings small expectations for the future, but exercise data raises caution.

2025-03.daily_overview: On Tuesday, Yu Xiaowen refocused more of her attention on her long-term personal goals. She began to develop a systematic study plan for the attending physician exam, while also not forgetting the new needs arising from the housing crisis—learning about rental knowledge and more detailed financial planning, though she stayed up late due to her studies.

events.name: Develop a review plan for the attending physician examination.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen sat at her desk and opened the outline for the attending physician examination. She assessed her grasp of internal medicine, particularly the cardiovascular section, and formulated a detailed study plan for the next month: each week, she would thoroughly read the guidelines for one disease chapter, accompanied by practice questions and case analysis. She first prioritized the "Chinese Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Heart Failure" as the focus for this week.

events.name: Actively learn about renting and rights knowledge
events.description: Making use of the fragmented time during her lunch break, Yu Xiaowen searched for practical information on her phone, such as [rental precautions], [how to identify black-market agents], and [key clauses in rental contracts]. She learned about tenants' legal rights when landlords sell their properties (such as the right of first refusal and the principle that "sale does not break a lease"), which gave her more confidence when dealing with her landlord.

events.name: Contact a financial advisor for an initial consultation.
events.description: Considering the establishment of an emergency fund and potential adjustments to investments, Yu Xiaowen left a message for financial advisor Wang Mingyuan via WeChat. She briefly explained that she might need to reserve some liquid funds due to a possible move and inquired about how to fine-tune her fund portfolio under current market conditions to balance both liquidity and stability. Manager Wang replied that he would analyze her holdings and provide suggestions afterward.

events.name: Review the chapter on heart failure.
events.description: To implement the plan, Yu Xiaowen carefully studied part of the heart failure guidelines in the evening, but due to the extensive content, she reviewed until quite late.

起始状态.心情: Focused and well-planned

结束状态.所处地点: Home Study Room, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Feeling clear about goals, gradually taking control of life, but slightly tired.

2025-03.daily_overview: Yu Xiaowen started her specialized review on heart failure as planned and relaxed by playing badminton with her friend Lin Wei. She adopted a multi-dimensional learning approach, including intensive reading of guidelines, watching cutting-edge seminars, and connecting with clinical cases, which proved highly effective. Meanwhile, the housing crisis prompted her to think long-term, leading her to begin exploring the real estate market in Zhengzhou.

events.name: Intensive Reading of Heart Failure Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen used the Pomodoro Technique to focus on a detailed study of the core chapters on pharmacological treatment for HFrEF (heart failure with reduced ejection fraction) in the "Chinese Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Heart Failure." She meticulously recorded in her notebook the timing, target dosages, and key monitoring points for the "golden triangle" medications—ACEI/ARB, beta-blockers, and aldosterone receptor antagonists.

events.name: Watch the Seminar on New Advances in Heart Failure
events.description: After completing the guide reading, she watched a previously cached online seminar video titled [The Revolutionary Role of SGLT2 Inhibitors in Heart Failure Treatment]. The latest clinical trial data shared by the expert gave her a deeper understanding of the background behind the guideline updates and future directions. She added key insights next to her notes.

events.name: Playing badminton with my friend Lin Wei.
events.description: After work in the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen, as usual, played badminton with Lin Wei at the gym for an hour. The exercise helped her temporarily forget her worries, but she also noticed that her reaction speed was not as sharp as before, possibly due to stress.

events.name: Initial Understanding of the Zhengzhou Real Estate Market
events.description: While browsing the rental app, Yu Xiaowen also switched to the second-hand housing channel out of curiosity, briefly checking the prices of small-sized apartments in Jinshui District and Zhongyuan District of Zhengzhou. The prices, often ranging from 15,000 to 16,000 yuan per square meter or even higher, left her astonished. During her lunch break, she casually asked her colleague Wang Fang about the home purchase qualifications and loan policies in Zhengzhou. Wang Fang mentioned that the down payment ratio was quite high, and the income verification requirements for doctors were particularly strict. Yu Xiaowen realized that buying a house was still a long-term goal that required significant savings for her at this stage.

起始状态.心情: Learning state initiated.

结束状态.所处地点: Home Study, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: The sense of fulfillment from learning, the realistic pressure from housing prices, and the slight relaxation after exercise.

2025-03.daily_overview: Yu Xiaowen continued to deepen her knowledge of heart failure and, through systematically organizing her exercise and health data, made a significant discovery: since receiving the landlord's notice on March 5, several of her physiological indicators, such as resting heart rate, sleep quality, and evening running pace, have shown quantifiable deterioration. This gave her an unprecedented and intuitive understanding of the relationship between stress and physical health.

events.name: Construct a mind map of heart failure knowledge
events.description: To connect scattered knowledge points into a network, Yu Xiaowen used mind mapping software to organize the causes, pathophysiology, classification, clinical manifestations, diagnostic processes, various drug treatments (including the traditional "golden triangle" and the new SGLT2i), non-drug treatments, and patient management of heart failure into a clear and visual knowledge system.

events.name: Apply critical thinking in conjunction with clinical cases.
events.description: She reviewed the heart failure patient she independently treated on March 3rd, attempting to analyze the case using the framework from the mind map: the patient had HFrEF and had already initiated the "golden triangle" therapy. Should the next step involve considering an SGLT2 inhibitor? At the same time, she also reflected on the differences in treatment strategies for HFpEF (heart failure with preserved ejection fraction) patients. This integration of theory with practice allowed her to grasp the knowledge more firmly.

events.name: Digital Insights into the Impact of Stress on Health
events.description: After her evening run, Yu Xiaowen synced her fitness tracker data as usual. However, today she specifically exported the data from the past two weeks into the trend chart of her health app for a closer look. The chart clearly showed that starting from March 5th, her average daily resting heart rate had risen from around 58 bpm to 65 bpm; her sleep quality scores had declined for several consecutive days; and even her average pace during evening runs had slowed by nearly 20 seconds per kilometer. This series of synchronized negative changes made her realize with shock that the psychological stress brought on by the housing crisis had already exerted a systematic and measurable impact on her body.

起始状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
起始状态.心情: Calm, ready to learn

结束状态.所处地点: Home Study Room, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Feeling alarmed and contemplative due to data discovery, I have decided to pay more attention to physical and mental regulation.

2025-03.daily_overview: On Friday evening, Yu Xiaowen fulfilled her promise to herself by going alone to the Zhengzhou Grand Theatre to enjoy a high-level classical music concert. The powerful sense of homesickness in Dvořák's "From the New World" Symphony and the profound introspection in Brahms' works deeply moved her, providing a two-hour mental sanctuary of complete immersion, free from the anxieties of work and house-hunting. However, she stayed up slightly later than usual due to the late end of the concert.

events.name: Embark on a Date with Classical Music
events.description: After work, Yu Xiaowen changed into a comfortable knit sweater and long skirt, then drove to the Zhengzhou Grand Theater. She arrived early and spent a few moments wandering through the brightly lit, art-filled lobby, allowing herself to detach from the medical environment of the day.

events.name: Immerse Yourself in a Symphony Feast
events.description: The lights dimmed in the concert hall as the conductor’s baton rose. When the familiar melody of Dvořák’s Symphony No. 9 in E Minor, “From the New World,” began to play, Yu Xiaowen was completely immersed. The deeply moving theme of the second movement, “Going Home,” inexplicably stirred her complex emotions of looking back at Luoyang from her current life in Zhengzhou, bringing a slight moistness to her eyes. In the second half, the rigorous structure and profound emotions of Brahms’s work allowed her to feel a sense of rational strength.

events.name: A solitary stroll after the music fades away.
events.description: After the concert ended, Yu Xiaowen didn't go to pick up her car right away. She strolled slowly along the street-side park next to the theater. The early spring night breeze carried a chill, but her heart was filled with warmth and tranquility from the music. The exhaustion of the day and the lingering anxiety of recent times seemed to have been carried away by the melodies and dissolved into the night. She savored this solitary, abundant peace.

events.name: Book a Pottery Experience Class
events.description: After returning home, inspired by the music, Yu Xiaowen contacted pottery teacher Zheng Guodong and booked a throwing experience class in April as part of her new stress-relief plan.

起始状态.心情: Looking forward to the evening concert.

结束状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province.
结束状态.心情: The tranquility, fulfillment, and subtle melancholy intertwined after being deeply soothed by art.

She communicated with her mentor about her progress in professional learning, proactively explored weekend activities that aligned with her interests, and took another step forward in her housing search—beginning to systematically screen rental listings online. At the same time, she also prepared for her gathering with close friends on Sunday, though anxiety and planning kept her up late.

events.name: Communicate learning progress with the mentor.
events.description: In the morning, Yu Xiaowen briefly reported to her mentor, Li Wei, via WeChat about her recent gains from reviewing the topic of heart failure. She also sought advice on a practical issue regarding medication adjustment for patients with heart failure complicated by renal insufficiency. Teacher Li quickly responded, providing principled guidance and recommending a relevant literature, encouraging her to delve deeper.

events.name: Discover and follow featured City Walk activities
events.description: While browsing a local lifestyle WeChat account, Yu Xiaowen stumbled upon a recruitment post titled [Exploring Modern Architecture in Zhengzhou: From the Erqi Tower to the State-Owned Cotton Mill]. Intrigued by the intellectual depth of this urban exploration, she carefully read through the route and the introduction of the lecturer. Although she couldn’t sign up due to a scheduling conflict, she bookmarked the organizer’s account, planning to keep an eye out for future events.

events.name: Online Screening of Desired Rental Properties
events.description: In the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen focused on filtering housing options on a rental app. Based on her previously outlined needs, she set precise filtering criteria: a rent range of 2,500–3,200 yuan, a one-bedroom apartment or the main room in a shared apartment, located in the Jinshui or Zhongyuan districts, and close to the subway. She carefully reviewed the photos and descriptions of over a dozen listings, added the five most promising ones to her favorites, and noted down the contact information of the agents, planning to schedule viewings for the following week.

events.name: Contact best friend Sun Yue to arrange a gathering tomorrow.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen remembered that her college best friend Sun Yue, whom she hadn't seen in a long time, was also in Zhengzhou. She sent a WeChat message to Sun Yue, expressing her recent restlessness and desire to take a walk and chat with someone. Sun Yue quickly replied, and the two coordinated their schedules, happily arranging to meet the following afternoon at a riverside park located midway between their homes.

events.name: Taking an evening walk to alleviate anxiety.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen took a 20-minute walk near her home, trying to relax, but her mind was still occupied with the issue of renting, resulting in a slow pace.

2025-04.daily_overview: Yu Xiaowen began this month with financial planning and preparations for a change in residence. As an early-rising resident physician, she started her day in the morning by managing her finances and organizing her life. During the day, she focused on her medical duties, while in the evenings, she concentrated on personal matters, preparing for her reading plan for the new month and realizing the need to find a new place to live. By the end of the day, she had not only solidified her work achievements but also laid the groundwork for changes in her daily rhythm over the next two weeks.

events.name: Initiate Monthly Financial Operations and Review
events.description: After washing up in the morning, Yu Xiaowen opened the China Merchants Bank app before breakfast. As she did on the first day of every month, she manually confirmed and executed the preset instruction for a 2,000 yuan fund fixed investment. The funds were transferred from her salary card and invested into a stable hybrid fund portfolio. She had long grown accustomed to this [disciplined investment] routine.

events.name: Morning Run Adjustment
events.description: At 07:15 in the morning, Yu Xiaowen went for a 20-minute jog in the residential area. Having woken up a bit late, she maintained a gentle pace during the exercise, focusing on heart rate recovery.

events.name: Procurement of Thematic Reading Books
events.description: During her lunch break, Yu Xiaowen used her phone to purchase several medical humanities books, including "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance," which she planned to read in April, from an online bookstore while in the doctor's lounge at the hospital. She deliberately chose the electronic versions for convenience, making it easier to read during fragmented moments and while on duty.

events.name: Launch a rental market research
events.description: Returning home on Jingsan Road after work, Yu Xiaowen assessed her soon-to-expire rental contract and the recent hints from her landlord, Aunt Song, about selling the apartment. She opened apps like Beike and Anjuke, setting her criteria centered around the hospital: a monthly rent budget of no more than 3,000 yuan, a commute within 20 minutes by car, and a preference for a one-bedroom, one-living-room layout. She began her preliminary search for properties in the Jinshui District. The dense information on the screen gave her a slight sense of pressure.

events.name: In-depth Review of First Quarter Financial Management Achievements
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen sat at her desk, turned on her computer, and logged into the financial management platform. She carefully reviewed the investment report for the first quarter (January to March), paying close attention to the average cost effect and cumulative returns brought by the dollar-cost averaging strategy amid market fluctuations. She updated the data in her personal financial spreadsheet and wrote down the insight: [Stay disciplined, hold long-term]. Later, she had a brief video call with her financial advisor, Wang Mingyuan, via WeChat. Wang affirmed the stability of the dollar-cost averaging strategy and addressed her questions regarding the impact of industry cycles.

起始状态.心情: Calm, with the anticipation of starting new plans at the beginning of the month, yet harboring a vague worry about the potential move.

结束状态.所处地点: Home Study Room, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Fulfilling yet slightly stressful, the peace of mind brought by clear financial planning intertwines with a subtle anxiety stemming from the uncertainties of the rental market.

2025-04.daily_overview: This day was a blend of professional growth and social responsibility. Yu Xiaowen not only honed her skills and reflected on her readings at work but also took on a public service task. Meanwhile, handling two practical matters—holiday duty and the ongoing search for housing—made her feel the urgency of time amidst her busy schedule. The boundaries between work and life became blurred, yet every task propelled her forward.

events.name: Consolidate the achievements of professional consultations.
events.description: Before morning rounds, Yu Xiaowen ran into Liu Qiang in the corridor of the department. She once again expressed her gratitude for the professional advice he had provided during her consultation the previous day, and casually mentioned that the adjustments made based on his suggestions were progressing smoothly. During the lunch break, she shared an interesting literature link related to the topic with Liu Qiang via WeChat as a gesture of appreciation. The two briefly exchanged a few thoughts on the viewpoints presented in the literature.

events.name: Qingming Festival Work Coordination
events.description: During a break in the morning, Yu Xiaowen checked the hospital scheduling system and confirmed that she was required to work on April 4th, the Qingming Festival. She proactively communicated with Wang Fang from the same team to coordinate some non-urgent paperwork, ensuring that ward affairs would run smoothly during the holiday period.

events.name: Immersive Reading and Reflection
events.description: During the lunch break, Yu Xiaowen avoided the noisy cafeteria and opened the e-book "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance" in the quiet doctor's duty room to read the first chapter. The book's discussion on medical errors and system improvements reminded her of a recent case she had handled, leading her into deep thought. She then jotted down a few ideas for improving work procedures in her phone's memo.

events.name: Accept the invitation to the community health lecture.
events.description: In the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen received a formal invitation from the Jinshui District Street Office through the hospital's labor union, inviting her to host a spring disease prevention lecture for middle-aged and elderly residents in the community. As a socially responsible ISFJ, she saw this as an excellent opportunity to give back to the community with her professional expertise. After reviewing her work schedule for April, she engaged in preliminary communication with the street office staff via WeChat, accepted the invitation, and tentatively confirmed the general theme of the lecture.

events.name: Deliberate Practice of CPR Skills
events.description: After work, Yu Xiaowen didn't go straight home but instead went to the clinical skills training center at the hospital. She borrowed a CPR model and practiced for an hour, strictly following the latest guidelines. She paid extra attention to the depth, frequency, and recoil of chest compressions, using her phone to time each cycle and ensure it met the standards. As a resident physician, she knew that this fundamental skill had to be mastered thoroughly.

events.name: Refine Housing Search Filters and Seek Assistance
events.description: At home in the evening, Yu Xiaowen further filtered the properties she had saved from the previous night, eliminating several options that clearly did not meet her more specific criteria, such as [commute convenience], [neighborhood security], and [renovation condition]. Meanwhile, she mentioned her need to find a new place to her close colleague Wang Fang and her best friend Zhang Jing via WeChat, asking them to keep an eye out for reliable properties or landlord recommendations.

events.name: Temporarily handling emergency cases
events.description: In the late afternoon, the department admitted a patient with acute chest pain. Yu Xiaowen assisted in handling the case and worked overtime for half an hour, ensuring the patient was stable before leaving work.

起始状态.心情: Clear objectives, ready for a compact day ahead.

结束状态.所处地点: At home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Busy yet fulfilling, I feel a hint of excitement about the upcoming lecture, but the to-do list for housing matters has added a few more items, leaving me slightly fatigued.

2025-04.daily_overview: On the last workday before the Qingming holiday, the pace quickened. Yu Xiaowen was making final preparations for her holiday work while also pushing forward with her personal affairs. Whether finalizing lecture details, scheduling a house viewing, or practicing specialized first aid, she demonstrated her efficient and pragmatic style. Arranging a holiday call with her parents added a touch of familial comfort to her busy life.

events.name: Specialized Practice for Infant First Aid
events.description: During a break in her morning work, Yu Xiaowen, who is preparing for her BLS instructor certification, went to the skills center. There, she used an infant manikin to practice infant CPR (using two fingers for chest compressions) and the Heimlich maneuver (back blows and chest thrusts). Her movements were exceptionally gentle, and she repeatedly verified their effectiveness, reflecting on the differences between infant and adult first aid.

events.name: Finalize the lecture arrangements with the community.
events.description: At noon, Yu Xiaowen had another phone conversation with the staff of the subdistrict office. Drawing on her medical expertise, she refined the lecture topic to [Prevention of High-Incidence Cardiovascular Diseases and Respiratory Infections in Spring]. Both parties finalized the lecture for Saturday morning, April 12, at the community activity center, and clarified the duration and target audience.

events.name: Officially launch the weekend house viewing plan
events.description: Before leaving work, Yu Xiaowen contacted three real estate agents through the Beike APP and WeChat, based on online screening and recommendations from colleagues and friends. She clearly communicated her requirements: a one-bedroom or small two-bedroom apartment in the Jinshui or Zhongyuan districts, close to a hospital, and within her budget. She successfully scheduled concentrated house viewings for April 5th and 6th, planned the viewing route, and demonstrated high efficiency.

events.name: Agreed to have a phone call with family on Qingming Festival.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen sent a message in the family WeChat group [Luoyang Hometown], informing her parents that she needed to work during the Qingming Festival and couldn’t return to Luoyang to visit the graves. Her mother, Li Xiuying, quickly replied, expressing understanding and suggesting a video call on the evening of April 4 to [see you and have a chat]. This simple arrangement brought warmth to Yu Xiaowen.

events.name: Establish personal criteria for house hunting.
events.description: Before going to bed, Yu Xiaowen, taking into account her financial situation (rent not exceeding one-third of her monthly salary), work characteristics (possible night shifts, requiring a quiet environment for rest), and lifestyle habits (enjoying cooking, needing space for reading), wrote a detailed list of criteria for finding a rental property in her notebook. This helped her maintain a clearer focus during subsequent house viewings.

events.name: Received greetings from high school classmates.
events.description: In the afternoon, I received a WeChat greeting from my high school classmate Liu Yang. We briefly chatted about our recent lives, and Liu Yang shared some technological insights from Shenzhen.

date_attribute.weather: On Qingming Festival, the sky was overcast with occasional drizzles, adding a touch of solemnity to the atmosphere.

2025-04.daily_overview: Against the backdrop of working on Qingming Festival, Yu Xiaowen experienced a day of weighing friendships and finding solace in family bonds. During the day, she calmly handled her work, and in the evening, she [reunited with her family in the cloud] via video call. A deep discussion with her close friend Zhang Jing about co-renting ended without resolution. Though she felt a slight sense of disappointment, it also helped her see reality more clearly, leading her to decide to face the upcoming challenge of finding a place to live on her own. Throughout the day, professional responsibilities, family ties, and personal realities intertwined.

events.name: Hospital Duty on Qingming Festival
events.description: According to the schedule, Yu Xiaowen was on the day shift in the cardiology ward. Compared to usual days, the outpatient volume had decreased, but the management of inpatients still required no slack. She handled medical orders and wrote progress notes in an orderly manner, during which she also calmly managed a blood pressure fluctuation in an elderly patient.

events.name: Discussing the Possibility of Renting an Apartment Together with a Close Friend in Depth
events.description: During the lunch break, Yu Xiaowen and Zhang Jing had a long phone call. Yu Xiaowen admitted that as a resident doctor, her schedule was highly irregular, often involving night shifts and emergency calls. Zhang Jing, on the other hand, mentioned that as an elementary school teacher, she needed to wake up early and required absolute quiet in the evenings for lesson preparation. The more they talked, the more they realized that their professional demands led to vastly different schedules and spatial needs. While the idea of sharing an apartment seemed appealing, practical obstacles made it challenging to realize.

events.name: A brief rest after work.
events.description: After finishing her shift and returning home, Yu Xiaowen felt a bit tired. She simply cooked a bowl of noodles for dinner, then organized the notes she had taken while viewing properties over the past few days. She categorized the housing information to prepare for tomorrow's on-site inspections.

events.name: Video Call with Parents on Qingming Festival
events.description: At eight o'clock in the evening, the video call connected right on time. On the other side of the screen were the concerned faces of her parents. Her father, Yu Jianguo, recounted his visit to their ancestors' graves earlier in the day, while her mother, Li Xiuying, eagerly asked how she was doing in Zhengzhou—whether she was eating well or feeling overworked. Yu Xiaowen shared her recent work stress and the challenges of finding a place to live. Her parents listened patiently, reminding her that "health is the foundation of everything; don’t push yourself too hard, and take your time with the apartment search." Though separated by the screen, the warmth of family affection eased the loneliness she felt living far from home.

events.name: The co-rental plan is put on hold, adjusting mindset.
events.description: After the video call, Yu Xiaowen received a message from Zhang Jing on WeChat. After some calm reflection, both agreed that maintaining the purity of their friendship was more important than forcing themselves to share an apartment. They ultimately decided not to proceed with the co-living plan. Though Yu Xiaowen felt a slight sense of regret, she also breathed a sigh of relief and began to plan her housing search anew, this time entirely on her own terms. She brewed a cup of hot tea, opened her phone to listen to Bach’s "Air on the G String" for a while, allowing her mind to settle.

起始状态.心情: Feeling a bit dreary from holiday duty, but looking forward to the family call tonight.

结束状态.所处地点: At home, No. 89 Jingsan Road, Jinshui District, Zhengzhou City, Henan Province
结束状态.心情: Warm yet complex. The care from family dispelled the loneliness, but a subtle sense of loss lingered from the shattered dream of sharing an apartment with a close friend. At the same time, it strengthened the resolve to solve problems independently.

date_attribute.weather: During the Qingming Festival holiday, the weather turned sunny with pleasant temperatures, making it perfect for outdoor activities.

2025-04.daily_overview: On the first day of the Qingming holiday, Yu Xiaowen devoted most of her energy to addressing the top priority of resolving her housing crisis. She entered an intensive [house-hunting mode], visiting multiple properties in person within half a day and gaining firsthand experience of the rental market reality. Meanwhile, she also managed to adjust her financial plans, explore personal interests, and engage in reading and learning during the gaps in her schedule, maintaining a tight and practical pace of life. An unconventional gaming experience in the evening served as an unexpected outlet for her tense nerves.

events.name: Concentrated House Viewing on the First Day of Qingming Holiday (Morning)
events.description: As scheduled, Yu Xiaowen followed the real estate agent in the morning to view six apartments in four residential complexes near Jingsan Road and Nongye Road. Like a meticulous inspector, she carefully examined the layout, natural lighting, condition of the renovation, and the brands of household appliances, while quietly assessing the neighborhood environment, security measures, and the convenience of nearby amenities. The house-hunting process gave her a clear understanding of the high rental prices in her desired area.

events.name: Received formal notice of property sale from the landlord.
events.description: During a break from work at noon, Yu Xiaowen received a WeChat message from her landlady, Aunt Song, who formally informed her of the plan to sell the apartment on Jingsan Road where she currently resides. Aunt Song requested her cooperation in showing the property to potential buyers and reminded her of the arrangements after the lease expires. This news suddenly heightened Yu Xiaowen’s sense of urgency in finding a new place to live.

events.name: Discussing house-hunting experiences with colleagues.
events.description: During a short break in the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen chatted with her friend and colleague Sun Yue on WeChat. Both of them rent apartments in Zhengzhou, and Yu vented about her morning house-hunting experience and the pressure of rental costs. Sun Yue shared her own past pitfalls when renting, strongly advising Yu to prioritize checking soundproofing and property management. She also recommended several tips for identifying potential issues when renting a place.

events.name: Minor Adjustments to Holiday Investment Portfolio Holdings
events.description: Returning home in the evening, Yu Xiaowen made a slight optimization adjustment to her fund portfolio through her mobile banking app, based on recent market research and Wang Mingyuan's suggestions. She converted some of the more volatile sector funds into more stable varieties, implementing her idea of [defensive allocation].

events.name: Immersive Gaming Experience (Late Night)
events.description: Strongly recommended by her best friend Sun Yue and considering that she could catch up on sleep tomorrow since it was Sunday, Yu Xiaowen decided to try a highly acclaimed narrative game. After starting the game at 9 p.m., she was immediately captivated by its exquisite visuals and profound storyline. She became completely immersed in the virtual world, following the characters through their joys and sorrows. Unconsciously, she played until 5 a.m., only realizing that dawn was breaking after completing the main storyline. This unconventional and thoroughly relaxing experience felt incredibly novel to her.

events.name: Supplement Implicit Events: Online Multi-Channel Property Search
events.description: In the intervals between waiting and contacting for house viewings, Yu Xiaowen did not stop searching. She not only browsed on major platforms like Beike and Lianjia but also tried to find direct rental listings from landlords in the Zhengzhou Rental Group and on Xianyu, hoping to save on agency fees. She contacted someone who claimed to be a landlord via WeChat video, briefly viewed the room, but the other party was vague about repair responsibilities, which made her wary.

events.name: Try ordering braised noodles for delivery.
events.description: During dinner, feeling exhausted from house hunting, Yu Xiaowen ordered takeout stewed noodles, which tasted good but were a bit greasy.

2025-04.daily_overview: After the previous day's running around and staying up late, Yu Xiaowen chose a balanced pace for this Sunday. She continued house hunting in the morning, followed by a relaxing City Walk with her best friend in the afternoon. House hunting helped her focus on her goals, while the city stroll effectively relieved the accumulated stress. After communicating with her family in the evening, she felt that finding a home was no longer a solitary battle.

events.name: Catching up on sleep to regain energy
events.description: Yu Xiaowen slept from the early morning until almost two in the afternoon before waking up, fully replenishing the sleep she had lost from staying up all night gaming. Although she still felt a bit drowsy after waking, her mind was much clearer, and she found herself reflecting on the thrilling plot of the game from the previous night.

events.name: House Viewing on the Second Day of the Qingming Holiday (Afternoon)
events.description: In the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen continued her house-hunting journey, focusing on three residential complexes near Dongfeng Road and Huayuan Road. This time, she paid special attention to the soundproofing of the rooms (by tapping the walls and closing the windows to listen for outside noise) and the condition of the kitchen and bathroom facilities. She meticulously recorded the pros and cons of each property on her phone. The more she looked, the more her internal scale of [cost-effectiveness] and [living comfort] wavered.

events.name: A City Walk in Zhengzhou's Old Town with My Best Friend Zhang Jing
events.description: At four in the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen and Zhang Jing met near the Erqi Memorial Tower. The two strolled leisurely along Dehua Street, admiring the modern architecture and spring street scenes, capturing the play of light and shadow with their phones. They visited a few independent bookstores and creative shops tucked away in small alleys, and Yu Xiaowen even bought a hand-fired ceramic bookmark. During their walk, she confided in Zhang Jing about the exhaustion of house-hunting and the pressure brought by her landlord selling the property. Zhang Jing’s attentive listening and encouragement lifted her spirits considerably.

events.name: Communicate with family about the progress of finding a house.
events.description: When she got home in the evening, Yu Xiaowen briefly mentioned in the family group chat that her plan to share an apartment with Zhang Jing had been canceled, and she informed her family that she had already started looking at properties in person. Her mother, Li Xiuying, immediately called to ask if she was having a hard time finding a place on her own, reminding her to prioritize safety and not rent a place that was too remote just to save money. The support from her family made her feel deeply comforted.

events.name: Organize viewing notes and photos.
events.description: Before going to bed, Yu Xiaowen organized the housing information she had viewed over the past two days and the photos she took during her daytime City Walk into her computer. She sorted the properties by her level of interest and realized that none of them gave her the feeling of "this is the one." She decided to expand her search area next week and take another look.

events.name: Supplement Implicit Events: Share Gaming Experience
events.description: Yu Xiaowen shared her feelings and astonishment about staying up all night to complete the game with Sun Yue via WeChat. The two discussed the game's plot choices and character fates for quite a while, and they agreed to play a cooperative game together next time via voice chat.

结束状态.心情: Relaxed and fulfilling. City Walk has effectively alleviated anxiety, and although there is still no result in finding a place to live, the mindset has become more peaceful and positive.

2025-04.daily_overview: The holiday ended, and life returned to its normal routine. Yu Xiaowen quickly switched gears, immersing herself in intense medical work during the day while using spare moments to refine her emergency response skills. At night, facing the stress of finding a new place to live, she chose to confide in her close friends. Their emotional support gave her the strength to keep moving forward. Meanwhile, reading and self-reflection continued to provide nourishment for her professional growth.

events.name: Returning to the workplace
events.description: Monday is always busy. Yu Xiaowen arrived at the hospital early, attended the morning meeting, made rounds, handled the backlog of medical orders and medical records from the holiday, and quickly got into the work mode.

events.name: Practice AED Use and Team Collaboration
events.description: During the lunch break, Yu Xiaowen returned to the skills center to use the AED training machine, simulating the entire process from discovering a patient to completing defibrillation. Imagining herself as a BLS instructor, she silently recited teaching instructions in her mind, simulating how to guide [trainees] in dividing tasks and collaborating during team resuscitation, preparing for her future role as an instructor.

events.name: Sharing stress with a close friend at night.
events.description: In the evening, the stress of house hunting and the landlord's push to sell made Yu Xiaowen feel somewhat agitated. She called her close friend Zhang Jing, detailing the troubles she encountered while viewing houses over the weekend and the landlord's attitude. On the other end of the line, Zhang Jing listened patiently, helping her analyze the pros and cons of each apartment and once again promising to keep an eye out for suitable listings together. [Don't rush, take your time, you'll find the right one eventually.] Her friend's comfort was like a soothing balm.

events.name: Reading Before Sleep and Professional Reflection
events.description: Before going to bed, Yu Xiaowen continued reading "Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance." When she reached the chapter on doctor-patient communication, she recalled a patient's family member from earlier in the day who had been anxious due to the patient's recurring condition. She reflected on whether she had fully understood the family member's fears at the time and reminded herself to pay more attention to her communication approach during tomorrow's ward rounds.

events.name: Slight headache due to anxiety.
events.description: During a break in the afternoon, Yu Xiaowen felt a slight headache, likely caused by the stress of house hunting. She took a short rest and drank a cup of warm water to alleviate it.

2025-04.daily_overview: On this day, Yu Xiaowen achieved multiple breakthroughs in her professional learning, interpersonal interactions, and personal problem-solving. Not only did she humbly seek guidance and expand her skills in her field, but she also gained valuable support and information by confiding in her colleagues. More importantly, after a prolonged battle of house hunting, she finally made a crucial decision and found a residence that met her needs, marking a turning point in alleviating the pressures of her life.

events.name: Learn the basics of cardiac ultrasound.
events.description: In the morning, under the guidance of the teacher in the cardiology ultrasound room, Yu Xiaowen systematically learned the basic sections and anatomical positioning of cardiac ultrasound. Subsequently, under the teacher's supervision, she attempted to perform a cardiac ultrasound examination on a patient with stable atrial fibrillation. Although her technique was still unrefined, she successfully identified key signs such as left atrial enlargement, sparking a strong interest in the technique of [cardiac ultrasound].

events.name: Exchange reading experiences with the mentoring teacher.
events.description: After the afternoon ward round, Yu Xiaowen proactively brought up the book *Better: A Surgeon's Notes on Performance* she was reading to her supervising teacher, Li Wei. She shared the book's perspective on how [deliberate practice] contributes to skill improvement. Li Wei praised her thoughtful reflection and, drawing from his years of clinical experience, shared insights on how to turn daily ward rounds and case discussions into opportunities for [deliberate practice].

events.name: Confide in colleagues and seek help.
events.description: At noon in the hospital cafeteria, Yu Xiaowen had lunch with her colleague Wang Fang. She couldn’t help but vent to Wang Fang about the exhausting house-hunting trips over the weekend and the bizarre properties she encountered. Wang Fang empathized with her and, after listening patiently, not only shared her own rental experience from last year but also offered to ask around in the hospital’s colleague group chat for any suitable subletting opportunities.

events.name: Independently inspect the surrounding environment of the intended property.
events.description: After work, Yu Xiaowen did not go home. Instead, she went again to the residential complexes where the two potential apartments she had seen over the weekend were located, near Jingsan Road. In the evening, she observed the street lighting, evening foot traffic, and surrounding noise levels (especially for the apartment close to the road). This inspection during [non-viewing hours] gave her a more realistic assessment of the living environment.

events.name: Make a key rental decision.
events.description: In the evening, Yu Xiaowen received a message forwarded by Wang Fang—a colleague from the hospital had a friend who urgently needed to sublet a one-bedroom apartment on Jianshe West Road in Zhongyuan District due to a job transfer. The lease was flexible, the price was within her budget, and it was only a 15-minute walk to the hospital. She immediately contacted the sublessor and the landlord via WeChat to discuss the details. After repeatedly comparing and weighing the convenience of the commute, she finally made up her mind and scheduled a signing for this weekend. The news brought her a great sense of relief.

2025-04.daily_overview: After achieving a breakthrough in her housing situation, Yu Xiaowen began to shift her focus toward personal health management. She tried a new Pilates class, embarking on targeted training to address occupational strain. Meanwhile, the continuous flow of rental information provided by her colleagues made her feel the warmth of a supportive network. This day, she spent navigating new physical challenges and embracing positive changes in her life.

events.name: First Pilates Experience Class
events.description: After work, Yu Xiaowen arrived punctually at the booked fitness studio near her workplace. In a small group class tailored for beginners, the coach focused on guiding core engagement and the coordination of breathing with movements. Yu Xiaowen realized that this was entirely different from the running and badminton she was familiar with—it required extremely precise muscle control and mental focus. She tried her best to follow along, but many movements felt challenging, especially when activating the deep stabilizing muscles, which felt unfamiliar and difficult. By the end of the class, she experienced an unprecedented deep stretch and soreness in her neck and shoulder areas.

events.name: After-Class Reflection and Thoughts Recording
events.description: On her way home, Yu Xiaowen carefully reflected on her feelings during the class. She realized that the posture issues caused by her long hours of desk work might stem from the weakness of these deep muscles. Although the challenge was significant, this precise training method seemed to directly address the core problems. She noted down keywords like [weak core], [difficulty controlling breathing], and [sensation in the neck and shoulders] in her phone's memo app, and seriously considered whether to incorporate this into her regular exercise routine.

events.name: Received ongoing rental support from colleagues.
events.description: In the evening, Wang Fang sent two more rental listings via WeChat, both of which she had helped inquire about. One was a shared room in the hospital staff compound, and the other was an apartment slightly farther away but offering excellent value for money. Wang Fang also included her own analysis: [The staff compound is safe but might be a bit old] and [The apartment is new but has a longer commute]. Yu Xiaowen was deeply touched and replied with a long message of gratitude, informing Wang Fang that she had almost settled on the one on Jianshe West Road. Wang Fang immediately sent a congratulatory sticker in response.

events.name: Apply the knowledge gained from reading to improve work performance.

After the rehearsal, she confirmed the details of the equipment for the next day, such as the projector and microphone, with the community staff via WeChat to ensure everything was ready.

She launched the puzzle game she had downloaded the day before and was instantly captivated by its intricate level design and artistic style. Exploring the puzzles at her own pace, she completely lost track of time, immersing herself in the dual pleasure of mental engagement and aesthetic appreciation. It wasn't until one in the morning that she reluctantly shut down the game, still yearning for more.
